channel.title: Help ? Compiler error
channel.description:
I downloaded deathlypk source and client , ive been coding for weeks now. and ive had to ditch 2 sources because of this error. im not quite sure how to fix. ive fiddled around and still nothing. so im at the point in my current source where i want to make it public. but before i do that theres a few things im attempting to change. well because of this error my compiler isnt working properly. it will not compile at all. heres the error can someone help ?
[sup]source\server\model\items\ItemAssistant.java:666: error: <identifier> expected if (Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j]. != n ull){ ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/sup]

item.title: Help ? Compiler error
item.dc:creator: @bob2568 bob2568
item.description:
@bob2568 wrote:

so basiclly to fix it i would need an item. so lets say i choose “3241 - random id” where would i work that into the equation

Read full topic

item.title: Help ? Compiler error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

bob2568:

alright , so how would i fix this ?

You need to point it to something in the itemlist file, or remove the period.

Read full topic

item.title: Help ? Compiler error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

bob2568:

Im not sure what you mean exactly. i input that and i got 100 errors lol…

Lol. It was an example. Not the real code.

Here’s another EXAMPLE:

int items = 0; if(items >= Config.MAXITEMS_AMOUNT){ c.sendMessage("You've got the max Items"); return; }
What this does (It’s completely incorrect.) is it’s checking if the int items is greater than or equal to the int MAXITEMS_AMOUNT stored in Config. If true, it returns.

So, to break it, it’d look like so:

int items = 0;
if(items >= Config.){
c.sendMessage("You've got the max items you can have");
return;
}

The server doesn’t know what you are looking for in Config.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bob2568 bob2568

item.title: Help ? Compiler error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“bob2568, post:8, topic:482814”]This is the only thing in my item assistant that looks like the problem.

public void getBonus() { for (int i = 0; i < c.playerEquipment.length; i++) { if (c.playerEquipment[i] > -1) { for (int j = 0; j < Config.ITEM_LIMIT; j++) { if (Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j]. != null){ if (Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j].itemId == c.playerEquipment[i]) { for (int k = 0; k < c.playerBonus.length; k++) { c.playerBonus[k] += Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j].Bonuses[k]; } break; } } } } } }

and no i downloaded this source and like i said ive been coding for weeks untill this.[/quote]

Look, this is the issue:

You have:
if (Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j]. != null){

It’s looking for something like this:

Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j].Bonuses[k]

Notice, how it has something trailing after the “ItemLost[j].”

Read full topic

item.title: Help ? Compiler error
item.dc:creator: @bob2568 bob2568
item.description:
@bob2568 wrote:

This is the only thing in my item assistant that looks like the problem.

public void getBonus() {
for (int i = 0; i < c.playerEquipment.length; i++) {
if (c.playerEquipment[i] > -1) {
for (int j = 0; j < Config.ITEM_LIMIT; j++) {
if (Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j]. != null){
if (Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j].itemId == c.playerEquipment[i]) {
for (int k = 0; k < c.playerBonus.length; k++) {
c.playerBonus[k] += Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j].Bonuses[k];
}
break;
}
}
}
}
}
}

and no i downloaded this source and like i said ive been coding for weeks untill this.

When i goto source/server/model/items itemlist.java this is the only thing inside
package server.model.items;

public class ItemList {
public int itemId;
public String itemName;
public String item;
public double ShopValue;
public double LowAlch;
public double HighAlch;
public int[] Bonuses = new int[100];

public ItemList(int _itemId) {
	itemId = _itemId;
}

}

Read full topic

item.title: Help ? Compiler error
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

it can’t find “itemDescription” inside of ItemList.

are you just copying code from a tutorial or a different source?

The period was the error. you technically have 3 errors, but sometimes the compiler doesn’t point them all out at once.

Read full topic

item.title: Help ? Compiler error

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

bob2568:

Like i said removing the period causes another error. it makes it even worse. and still has the first error.

How about you show us the method where the error is.

item.title: Help ? Compiler error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“hat trix, post:2, topic:482814”]The best way to go about fixing an error is to go to the line the error is providing, in this case, line 666. take a look at that line, figure out what is causing the error.

btw, the error is the period beind ItemList[j]?

I’m pretty sure thats the error.[/quote]
I’d have to agree. From what I see, it’s expecting something to be after it.

Like:

 if (Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j].itemName("cards") != null){

//Code here
}

Obviously I made that up.

escription.startsWith(“Swap this note at any bank for a”) == false) {

^
symbol: variable itemDescription

Press any key to continue . . .
